element.name: Patient Evaluation/Care
element.definition: The patient disposition for an EMS event identifying whether a patient was evaluated and care or services were provided.
element.v3Comment: Grouped with Incident and Transport Dispositions. Who provided care or services is defined in Incident Disposition.
element.v3Changes: Element added with the release of v3.5.0

asserts.assert: Patient's Home County should be recorded when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided".
Patient's Home State should be recorded when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided".
Patient's Home ZIP Code should be recorded when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided".
Race should be recorded when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided".
Age should be recorded when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided".
Age Units should be recorded when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided".
Sex should be recorded when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided".
Date/Time of Symptom Onset should be recorded when Type of Service Requested is "Emergency Response (Primary Response Area)" and Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided".
Possible Injury should be recorded when Type of Service Requested is "Emergency Response (Primary Response Area)" and Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided".
Primary Symptom should be recorded when Type of Service Requested is "Emergency Response (Primary Response Area)" and Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided".
Provider's Primary Impression should be recorded when Type of Service Requested is "Emergency Response (Primary Response Area)" and Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided".
Initial Patient Acuity should be recorded when Type of Service Requested is "Emergency Response (Primary Response Area)" and Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided".
Date/Time Last Known Well should be recorded when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided" and Cardiac Arrest is "Yes...".
Date/Time Last Known Well should be recorded when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided" and Stroke Scale Result is "Positive".
Date/Time Last Known Well should be recorded when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided" and Cardiac Rhythm / Electrocardiography (ECG) is "STEMI...".
Cause of Injury should be recorded when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided" and Possible Injury is "Yes".
Cardiac Arrest Etiology should be recorded when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided" and Cardiac Arrest is "Yes...".
Resuscitation Attempted By EMS should be recorded when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided" and Cardiac Arrest is "Yes...".
Arrest Witnessed By should be recorded when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided" and Cardiac Arrest is "Yes...".

AED Use Prior to EMS Arrival should be recorded when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided" and Cardiac Arrest is "Yes, Prior to Any EMS Arrival (includes Transport EMS & Medical First Responders)".
Any Return of Spontaneous Circulation should be recorded when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided" and Cardiac Arrest is "Yes...".
End of EMS Cardiac Arrest Event should be recorded when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided" and Cardiac Arrest is "Yes...".
Acuity Upon EMS Release of Patient should be recorded when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided".
Unit Disposition should be "Patient Contact Made" when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated..." or "Patient Refused Evaluation/Care".
Patient Evaluation/Care should be recorded when Unit Disposition is "Patient Contact Made".
Patient Evaluation/Care should be "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided" when Crew Disposition contains "... Primary Care..." or "Provided Care Supporting Primary EMS Crew".
Level of Care Provided per Protocol should be recorded (with a value other than "No Care Provided") when Patient Evaluation/Care is "Patient Evaluated and Care Provided".
When Patient Evaluation/Care has a Not Value (Not Applicable, Not Recorded, or Not Reporting), it should be empty.

When Patient Evaluation/Care is empty, it should have a Not Value (Not Applicable, Not Recorded, or Not Reporting, if allowed for the element) or a Pertinent Negative (if allowed for the element), or it should be omitted (if the element is optional).
